title: Surrender of Sultan Mahmud Badaruddin II after the Dutch expedition against Palembang

  physical_appearance: This is  a multicoloured aquatint depicting the surrender of Sultan Mahmud Badaruddin II after the Dutch expedition against Palembang in 1821. Most of aquatint is covered by Dutch vessels and flags. There are three lines of text in Dutch at the bottom of the aquatint specifying the title of this scene of surrender.

  subject_terms_1: proofs (prints by function) schooners expeditions (journeys) watercraft illustrations (layout features) flags

 Pulau (island)

  sgcool_label_text: In 1821
 the Dutch launched an expedition against Sultan Mahmud Badaruddin of Palembang
 who had been hostile against Dutch. The expedition was successful
 and the Sultan is depicted in this print being escorted to the Dutch vessel Joanna
 later to be exiled to Ternate. This aquatint was produced by J. A. Lutz
 after an original work by H. P. Oosterhuis.

metadata.sgcool_label_text: In 1821, the Dutch launched an expedition against Sultan Mahmud Badaruddin of Palembang, who had been hostile against Dutch. The expedition was successful, and the Sultan is depicted in this print being escorted to the Dutch vessel Joanna, later to be exiled to Ternate. This aquatint was produced by J. A. Lutz, after an original work by H. P. Oosterhuis.
